title.narrative: (DAM) Humanitarian assistance to the most vulnerable flood-affected people in Kurigram and Jamalpur

description.narrative: A. Multi-Purpose Cash Grant (MPCG) of BDT 4,500 each given to 3,852 households, family size = 5 members, overall beneficiaries = 19,260 people. B. Hygiene kits given to 3,852 households, containing 1 bottle Savlon liquid 500 ml, 5 bath soap and 5 detergent bars, 1 pack sanitary napkin, 1 plastic soap cases, plastic bucket with lid (20L capacity) and 1. plastic mug and 10L jerry can (water carrier). C. Hygiene promotion sessions will be conducted during hygiene kit distribution and key IEC material messaging will be provided for behaviour change communication for health seeking behavior promotion. D. 64 most vulnarable( older people; people with disability; pregnent women) will recieve additional BDT 1000 as cash grant

Christian Aid and consortium partners will target the most affected communities based on pre-defined selection criteria. Full care will be taken to involve the local communities in the identification of those who are most vulnerable and confirm selection criteria. Primary targets will include families who have so far not received adequate humanitarian assistance from government response and other humanitarian agencies. Christian Aid and consortium partners will target extremely marginalised, poor and socially excluded communities who have intersectional vulnerabilities and have specific needs severely affected by the flood and have lost their food stocks, houses are submerged; livestock are at risk and lost other household belongings. Following this targeted approach, 50% of beneficiaries will be extremely marginalized and vulnerable households in the target area.
